title: Inverse Trig Domains
description: An interactive visualization that demonstrates why domain restrictions are necessary for inverse trigonometric functions using the horizontal line test.
creator: Claude Code
subject: Mathematics
Precalculus
Trigonometry
Inverse Functions
learningObjectives: Identify the domain and range of each inverse trigonometric function
Understand why domain restrictions are necessary for inverse functions
Recognize that the horizontal line test for the original function corresponds to the vertical line test for the inverse
List the conventional domain restrictions for all six inverse trig functions
prerequisites: Graphs of sine, cosine, tangent, and their reciprocals

controls.label: Horizontal line y
controls.description: Controls the y-position of the horizontal line used to demonstrate why restrictions are needed

controls.label: Why this range?
controls.description: Toggles display of explanation for the chosen domain restriction

interactions.description: Selecting an inverse trig function updates both graphs and the domain/range display
Moving the horizontal line shows multiple intersections on the unrestricted curve but only one on the restricted portion
Reveals explanation text for why mathematicians chose this particular domain restriction
